result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Gleysteen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, restitution and DNA & DV surcharge during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court set restitution hearing to determine amount.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No contact with victim, except for third party contact for time with children, unless approved by court or agent.
No violent contact toward or around minor children.

Batterer's Intervention Program.
Parenting class.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Gleysteen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher J Gleysteen in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further is not needed.

Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court, defendant Christopher J Gleysteen not in court, in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Restitution Hearing. Defendant NOT produced. Victim NOT present in court, state can not proceed with hearing without documentation. Court set restitution at ZERO.
Due to clerical error, case was mis-calendared for 9/11/2014 instead of 9/16/2014. Parties notified and date corrected.

Defendant Christopher J Gleysteen in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf. Matthew Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Victim addressed the court. Court reviewed and returned photographs from the victim and the state.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 250 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS. **SERVE 75 DAYS of Condition Time, Upfront, Forthwith, no good time, straight time.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve an additional 60 DAYS (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Parenting class.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim, except for third party contact for time with children, unless approved by court or agent.
-No violent contact toward or around minor children.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, restitution and DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court set Restitution Hearing to determine amount.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Information from Defense as to Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state, the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court VACATED the Jury Trial date. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Christopher J Gleysteen in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial, parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Received & Filed, Amended Information.
AMENDED INFORMATION READS:
COUNT 1 Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2 Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections(s) 940.19(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, 2 Letters on behalf of defendant.
Received & Filed, Cover Letter & Letter on behalf of the defendant.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 05/27/14. AR

JUDGE STARK FOR JUDGE GRADY
Defendant Christopher J Gleysteen in court with attorney Amber K Rumpf.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher J Gleysteen in court with attorney Amber K Rumpf.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sinceree D.

Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.
The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher J Gleysteen in court with attorney Amber K Rumpf.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The Da's office called and the court date was moved from 6-16-2014 to 4-17-2014, at 1:30 pm. Rm. 221, out of custody court.
Deputy Court Clerk - jam
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/16/14 at 1:00pm.
